H910.def: = the state of being apart from significant others

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H4082.def: = an adminstrative division of a country or a city

H4522.def: = a class of people who are enlisted compulsorily to do work for others

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H1832.def: = fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning

H3895.def: = the lower bony structure of the skull of humans and certain animals that forms the framework of the mouth and holds the teeth

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H4494.def: literally: rest; hence: = a state of mind in which humans find relief after a time of distress

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H4712.def: = a state in which humans experience extreme anxiety, ◄ as a result of difficult circumstances, as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H7951.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H1926.def: = state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H354.def: = wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess

H4829.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H5206.def: = state in which objects are considered impure because of their association with evil practices

H7757.def: = the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H584.def: = action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7797.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H585.def: = act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1742.def: literally, "weak in one's heart"; hence: = state in which someone feels unable to think or act properly ◄ as a result of hardship in one's own or someone else's life
